caption: Figure 1: Comparison between CFT and SFT on 50K samples from WebInstruct (Yue et al., 2024b). SFT-verified means SFT training on the responses validated by GPT-4o, SFT-GPT4o means SFT training on the responses from GPT-4o. CFT is our approach, which trains on the critique provided by GPT-4o.
description: Figure 1 presents a comparison of the performance of Critique Fine-Tuning (CFT) and Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) methods on a dataset of 50,000 samples from WebInstruct.  The figure showcases the effectiveness of CFT in improving model performance on different mathematical reasoning benchmarks.  Three variants of SFT are shown:  one trained on responses verified by GPT-40 ("SFT-verified"), one trained directly on GPT-40's generated responses ("SFT-GPT40"), and a baseline SFT model. In contrast, CFT trains the model using critiques of noisy responses, also generated by GPT-40.  The results demonstrate that CFT achieves consistently better performance than the SFT approaches across various benchmarks.
